title: Dominican Republic: Citi Signs Agreement with the Treasury of Social Security
summary: Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic - Citi Dominican Republic signed an agreement with the Treasury of Social Security (TSS), after being certified by UNIPAGO as a tax collector bank for TSS. The agreement will enable Citi corporate clients to pay their taxes and social security contributions, both from the TSS and the Tax on Income (ISR) as well as INFOTEP. The "Citidirect" electronic banking platform centralizes the payments process.
tag-1: Dominican Republic: Citi Signs Agreement with the Treasury of Social Security
tag-3: Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic – Citi Dominican Republic signed an agreement with the Treasury of Social Security (TSS), after being certified by UNIPAGO as a tax collector bank for TSS. The agreement will enable Citi corporate clients to pay their taxes and social security contributions, both from the TSS and the Tax on Income (ISR) as well as INFOTEP. The "Citidirect" electronic banking platform centralizes the payments process.
tag-4: The agreement signed between top Citi executives and TSS took place January 31, during a meeting at the TSS headquarters.
tag-5: This new service strengthens the e-Tax Payment product, which allows customers to pay all their taxes and contributions of different governmental agencies (DGII, DGA and TSS). Citi is the first foreign financial institution involved in the tax collection process of the Dominican Social Security Scheme.
tag-6: "By entering into this agreement and activating this service, we have completed the offer of payment services to the government. Now our customers can channel all their payments to the government via Citi," said Marco Decormis, Vice President of Citi Global Transaction Services. Once again, Citi reaffirms the commitment of offering its customers new and better solutions to their financial needs through innovative products and excellent service.
tag-7: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
